Posts.Content: Hi, This is my  first time trying this but I have some concerns and worries about the side effect of xeloda.  In 2006 I had a mastectomy, and 1 out of 23 lymph nodes with ca.  I had chemo and did well, and was on Arminidex.   I now has mets  to my spine and shoulder. I am on my second round to xeloda 2000mg a day two weeks on one week off.  I have also started once a month IV of Zometa.  I feel good, but am so worried about the side effects expecially the hands and feet.  I cream them 3 times a day, but can't walk for a long time.  I am starting to get some buring in my feet, is this the start.  I just need someone to write me back and reasure me of what I can expect with this treatment.
Posts.Title: side effects of xeloda

Posts.Content: My message was also the first time to this site.  So far I have only had a little burning of my feet when I stand to long or walk for about a half an hour.  I am only on my third round of xeloda.  I am going away this summer for 3 months  and wondering what to expect.  When the syndrom occurs about how long does it take to clear up once your off the xeloda, and are you really immoblizie, as far as normal routine?  Sorry I took so long to reply I was away for 2 weeks no computer available.  Think positive, and all the best to you.    AMD Long Island, New York
Posts.Title: side effects of xeloda
